did.unittitle: Barry and Gloria Garfinkel collection of photographs
did.abstract: This collection consists of 39 black and white photographs by various photographers. The photographs date from 1946-1974, and feature portraits of prominent people and New York City street scenes.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.

prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: Barry and Gloria Garfinkel Collection of Photographs, PR 382, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Barry and Gloria Garfinkel, 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 39 black and white photographs by various photographers, including Victor Laredo, Fritz Henle, Arnold Eagle, Jill Freedman, Bruce Davidson, Jerry Lang, N. Jay Jaffee, Fons Ianelli, Fred McDarrah, Ken Regan, Ron Galella, and Arthur Leipzig. The photographs date from 1946-1974. Some photos feature portraits of prominent people, such as Truman Capote, Bella Abzug, John Cassavetes, and Diane Keaton. Other photos capture New York City street scenes, including police officers on the beat, children playing, iconic buildings, and views in Central Park.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This material was originally included in the finding aid for the Michael Sonnenfeldt Collection of Theatre, Film, and Entertainment Photography PR 305, which was processed by project intern Brynn White in 2014. This material was separated into a discrete collection and finding aid in 2019 by processing archivist Marybeth Kavanagh.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is aranged alphabetically by photographer.
